title: Practice Challenge
description: Apply what you've learned in this interactive coding challenge.
instructions:
Create a simple calculator using switch!

1. Create a string variable 'operation' (set to '+', '-', '*', or '/')
2. Create int variables num1 = 10 and num2 = 5
3. Use a switch statement on 'operation':
   - case "+": Display num1 + num2
   - case "-": Display num1 - num2
   - case "*": Display num1 * num2
   - case "/": Display num1 / num2
   - default: Display 'Unknown operation'

Remember to use break after each case!

hints.text: Structure: switch (operation) { case "+": code here; break; case "-": code here; break; ... }. Don't forget break!
Forgetting break: Without break, code 'falls through' to the next case! Always end each case with break (unless you want fall-through).
Using variables in case: case myVariable: is WRONG! case values must be constants: case 1: or case "text":
Forgetting quotes on strings: case jump: is wrong! String cases need quotes: case "jump":
Using conditions in case: You can't do case (x > 5): ! Switch only checks EQUALITY. Use if-else for conditions.
